title: Students across Iran stage protest as economic crisis deepens
byline: Iranian students staged street protests in Tehran on Tuesday, a day after the capital’s shopkeepers demonstrated against economic hardship and won a message of understanding from the president.

title: Commission of Inquiry appointed to investigate irregularities at the Colombo Municipal Council
byline: A Presidential Commission of Inquiry has been appointed to investigate, examine, and report on alleged corruption and irregularities said to have taken place at the Colombo Municipal Council.

title: Special traffic and security plan in Colombo for New Year celebrations
byline: Sri Lanka Police have decided to implement a special traffic and security plan to minimise traffic congestion in and around Colombo and ensure public safety.

title: Last rites of music icon Latha Walpola with state patronage today
byline: The final rites of legendary Sri Lankan singer Latha Walpola is scheduled to be performed with state patronage this evening (31) at the Borella General Cemetery.

title: Shooting incident reported in Nagoda Hospital
byline: A shooting incident has been reported within the Nagoda Teaching Hospital, police stated.

title: Fairly heavy showers above 75 mm expected in several provinces today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, Eastern, Central, Northcentral, Northwestern and Uva provinces.

title: FM Vijitha Herath departs for Dhaka to attend funeral ceremony former Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has departed for Dhaka, Bangladesh this morning (31).

title: Gold rebounds, poised to cap off best year in over four decades
byline: Precious metals rebounded on Tuesday, after falling sharply in the previous session, as the market refocused on geopolitical and economic risks, reigniting gold’s rally to cap its best year since 1979.

title: Two Russian nationals rescued after being swept away by strong currents at Kabalana Beach
byline: Two Russian nationals who went sea bathing at Kabalana Beach were rescued after being swept away by strong water currents.

title: BASL draws President’s attention on promotions issued to judicial officers and judges
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has drawn President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s attention to the process of promotions of Judicial Officers, Judges of the High Court and the Court of Appeal in recent months.

title: Israel suspends 37 aid organisations from operating in Gaza
byline: Israel is to revoke the licenses of 37 aid groups working in Gaza and the occupied West Bank, saying they failed to meet requirements under new registration rules.

title: Revolver used by assailant in Nagoda hospital shooting – Police
byline: New details have emerged in relation to the shooting incident at the Nagoda Teaching Hospital in Kalutara this morning, police said.

title: Mortal remains of late Latha Walpola brought to Independence Square
byline: The mortal remains of ‘Queen of Sri Lankan music’ Kalasoori Latha Walpola has been brought to the Independence Square in Colombo for the general public to pay their last respect.

title: Education Ministry Secretary lodges complaint with CID
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Nalaka Kaluwewe has lodged a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Nearly 3,000 children under probation care lack birth certificates
byline: Nearly 3,000 children under the age of 16, who have been placed in probation and child care centres based on court orders, do not possess birth certificates, the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs has revealed.

title: Taavi Samaraweera climbs to No. 1 in U-11 Boys’ World Table Tennis Rankings
byline: Sri Lanka’s Taavi Samaraweera has climbed to No. 1 in the U-11 Boys’ World Table Tennis Rankings.

title: Thailand frees 18 Cambodian soldiers under new ceasefire deal
byline: Thailand released 18 Cambodian soldiers on Wednesday under a renewed ceasefire agreed by the two countries at the weekend, authorities from both countries said, easing tensions after weeks of deadly border clashes.

title: Individual who contested the last General Election dies in accident
byline: An individual who contested the last General Election from the Ratnapura District under the National People’s Power (NPP) ticket has been killed in a head-on collision involving a motorcycle and a private bus, police said.

title: Five injured and admitted to hospital following lorry-van collision in Ratnapura
byline: At least five individuals have been injured and admitted to the Ratnapura Teaching Hospital following a head-on collision between a lorry and a van at the Thiriwanaketiya Junction in Ratnapura this morning (31).

title: Five councilors arrested over yesterday’s commotion at Galle MC
byline: A total of five members of the Galle Municipal Council have been arrested in connection with an unrest that broke out during the council session yesterday (30).

title: Matugama PS Chairman surrenders to police
byline: The Chairman of the Matugama Pradeshiya Sabha, who is accused of assaulting the Secretary of the council has surrendered to police.

title: Colombo Municipal Council budget passed
byline: The annual budget of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) has been passed with a majority of two votes.

title: Turkey detains 125 more Islamic State suspects as nationwide sweep continues
byline: Turkish authorities on Wednesday pressed ahead with nationwide operations against suspected Islamic State members, detaining 125 people in simultaneous raids across 25 provinces.

title: Former Minister Johnston Fernando’s son produced in court
byline: Johan Fernando, the son of former Minister Johnston Fernando, who was arrested yesterday (30) by the Financial Crimes Investigation Department (FCID), has been produced before court.

title: Remote Pacific nation becomes first place in the world to welcome 2026
byline: The island of Kiritimati is welcoming in the new year - the first place in the world do so.

title: Fairly heavy showers about 75 mm likely in several provinces tomorrow
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in the Northern, Eastern, Central, North-central, North-western and Uva provinces, tomorrow (01), according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Indian rupee set for worst annual fall in three years amid equity outflows
byline: The Indian rupee is poised for its largest annual fall in three years, weighed down by record equity outflows and the lack of a U.S. trade deal that left it out of the rally across Asia, with prospects for a recovery tied to the trade pact.

title: Former Minister Johnston Fernando’s son remanded
byline: Johan Fernando, the son of former Minister Johnston Fernando, who was arrested yesterday (30) by the Financial Crimes Investigation Department (FCID), has been remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Israel to ban 37 aid groups operating in Gaza
byline: Israel has said 37 aid organisations will be banned from operating in Gaza from Thursday unless they comply with guidelines requiring detailed information on Palestinian staff, drawing criticism from the United Nations and the European Union.

title: Five opposition members of Galle MC granted bail
byline: The five opposition members of the Galle Municipal Council, who were arrested for intimidating and obstructing the duties of officials during an incident yesterday at the council, have been granted bail by the Galle magistrate’s Court.

title: First sitting of Parliament for the New Year on January 6
byline: Parliamentary business for the first sitting week of Parliament for January 2026 was decided at the Committee on Parliamentary Business meeting held today (31) under the chairmanship of the Speaker, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: Pakistan tour profit to be donated to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ program – SLC
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) today announced that it will dedicate the upcoming Pakistan Tour of Sri Lanka to promoting the government’s ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ program.

title: Matugama PS chairman granted bail
byline: The Chairman of the Matugama Pradeshiya Sabha, Kasun Munasinghe, has been granted bail by the Matugama Magistrate’s Court.

title: Legendary singer Latha Walpola laid to rest with state honours
byline: The final rites of the late veteran singer Kalasoori Latha Walpola, revered as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Music,” concluded with state patronage this evening (31) at the Borella General Cemetery in Colombo.

title: SLMC suspends party membership CMC councillor who supported budget
byline: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) has suspended the party membership of Colombo Municipal Councillor Zohara Buhary with immediate effect, citing a serious violation of party discipline.

title: China’s Xi hails nation’s technological progress and renews promise to take back Taiwan
byline: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday hailed his country’s technological progress in areas such as artificial intelligence and semiconductors while once again insisting his country would annex self-ruled Taiwan.

title: Gazette issued to establish ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka Presidential Task Force’
byline: A Gazette notification has been issued by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, establishing a ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka Presidential Task Force’.

title: Magnitude 6 earthquake strikes off coast of Japan’s Noda region
byline: A magnitude 6 earthquake struck off the coast of Japan’s eastern Noda region on Wednesday, the United States Geological Survey said. The quake was at a depth of 19.3 km (11.99 miles), the USGS said.

title: 114 shooting incidents with 60 fatalities reported in 2025
byline: With only a few hours remaining before the end of the year 2025, two separate shooting incidents were reported in different parts of the country within a span of eight hours, police reported.
